meanings.definition: To fill (a container or space) tightly with something
meanings.sent1: She packed her suitcase with clothes for the trip.
meanings.sent2: The students packed the boxes with books for the library.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel packed its cheeks with nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The stadium was packed with cheering fans.
meanings.sent5: The bus was so packed with passengers that there was no empty seat left.

meanings.definition: To bring together in a group
meanings.sent1: The teacher packed the students together for a group photo.
meanings.sent2: The event packed people from all over the city in one place.
meanings.sent3: The kids packed their toys together to share and play.
meanings.sent4: The team packed their gear and headed to the game.
meanings.sent5: The family packed their bags and went on a vacation together.

meanings.definition: To be full of people or things
meanings.sent1: The train station was packed with travelers during the holiday season.
meanings.sent2: The concert hall was packed with music lovers for the performance.
meanings.sent3: The fridge was packed with delicious leftovers from the party.
meanings.sent4: The beach was packed with umbrellas and beach towels on a sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The classroom was packed with students eager to learn.
